title: DBT Coach: (Dialectical Behavior Therapy app)
description:
This is the most comprehensive DBT app that exists today with easy to follow visual tools.

Learn and practice DBT skills using video lessons and fun animations which helps you to remember skills longer. Features over 100 videos and 200+ animations. You can also take notes on these lessons for future use.

User friendly diary card for skills and target behaviors. Summary screens to check your progress. Analytics to get insight into your own behavior as you learn new skills. Ability to share with therapists and care team.

Track your progress on how you are doing and get motivated to obtain new skills. Get awards for tasks done towards obtaining new skills or keeping up with one you already know.

Complete exercises and practice ideas that are similar to worksheets in actual DBT skills training. There are over 100 exercises. You can also see a history of all the exercises that you did in the past to compare. Each of the exercise link directly to lessons.

Over 1000 meditations ranging across multiple themes from some of the best teachers in the world.

Favorites list to save skills and meditations you use frequently.

Crisis survival list to manage your crisis.

Community tools such as Discussion Groups and Peer Support Groups to help you practice and share knowledge about DBT Skills.

Finally, the app integrates with a clinician app. If your therapist is signed up and you are set up to share your diary card and exercises then you don’t have to share via email every week. Your therapist can engage with you in real time.

Dialectical behavior therapy (DBT) treatment is a type of psychotherapy — or talk therapy — that utilizes a cognitive-behavioral approach. It began with efforts to treat borderline personality disorder (also known as Emotional Instability Disorder). DBT has been conceptualized as a treatment that is broadly applicable for individuals who have difficulties regulating emotion. Empirical evidence now supports the use of DBT adapted for eating disorders, substance use disorders, and PTSD.

 Payment will be charged to your Playstore account at confirmation of purchase
*You have a choice of being billed monthly for $11.99/month or a discounted price of $59.99 every six months. 
• Subscription automatically renews unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period
• Account will be charged for renewal within 24-hours prior to the end of the current period, and identify the cost of the renewal
• Subscriptions may be managed by the user and auto-renewal may be turned off by going to the user's Account Settings after purchase
• Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when the user purchases a subscription to that publication, where applicable.

Privacy Policy:http://www.swasth.co/privacy
Terms of use: http://www.swasth.co/terms
descriptionHTML:
This is the most comprehensive DBT app that exists today with easy to follow visual tools.

Learn and practice DBT skills using video lessons and fun animations which helps you to remember skills longer. Features over 100 videos and 200+ animations. You can also take notes on these lessons for future use.

User friendly diary card for skills and target behaviors. Summary screens to check your progress. Analytics to get insight into your own behavior as you learn new skills. Ability to share with therapists and care team.

Track your progress on how you are doing and get motivated to obtain new skills. Get awards for tasks done towards obtaining new skills or keeping up with one you already know.

Complete exercises and practice ideas that are similar to worksheets in actual DBT skills training. There are over 100 exercises. You can also see a history of all the exercises that you did in the past to compare. Each of the exercise link directly to lessons.

Over 1000 meditations ranging across multiple themes from some of the best teachers in the world.

Favorites list to save skills and meditations you use frequently.

Crisis survival list to manage your crisis.

Community tools such as Discussion Groups and Peer Support Groups to help you practice and share knowledge about DBT Skills.

Finally, the app integrates with a clinician app. If your therapist is signed up and you are set up to share your diary card and exercises then you don’t have to share via email every week. Your therapist can engage with you in real time.

Dialectical behavior therapy (DBT) treatment is a type of psychotherapy — or talk therapy — that utilizes a cognitive-behavioral approach. It began with efforts to treat borderline personality disorder (also known as Emotional Instability Disorder). DBT has been conceptualized as a treatment that is broadly applicable for individuals who have difficulties regulating emotion. Empirical evidence now supports the use of DBT adapted for eating disorders, substance use disorders, and PTSD.

Payment will be charged to your Playstore account at confirmation of purchase
*You have a choice of being billed monthly for $11.99/month or a discounted price of $59.99 every six months.
• Subscription automatically renews unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period
• Account will be charged for renewal within 24-hours prior to the end of the current period, and identify the cost of the renewal
• Subscriptions may be managed by the user and auto-renewal may be turned off by going to the user's Account Settings after purchase
• Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when the user purchases a subscription to that publication, where applicable.

Privacy Policy:http://www.swasth.co/privacy
Terms of use: http://www.swasth.co/terms
summary: A comprehensive DBT App for BPD, Anxiety, Depression, Stress, Bipolar Disorder
recentChanges: Some bug fixes and performance enhancements.
comments: I really really like this app, DBT saved my life -- I still have much to improve upon. Practicing DBT on a daily basis has helped me to regain control of my emotions and allows me to stay focused and determined. DBT Coach is outstanding as a stand alone app, but for me personally it provides an effective substitution for a therapist during this transtion until I am able to afford individual sessions again.
For $11.99 a month the app keeps crashing when certain lessons are opened. So you're paying for an app the only some content works. It's a shame because if it worked properly it would be worth it.

The app is WAY overpriced. I would not balk for a minute at a $5.99/month subscription but this is priced out of the market, especially since it is a health care focused app. The language is not in vernacular English all the time, which is annoying. Hire an editor for clarity is a pretty minimal ask for short, static screens and would cost very little. The validation skill could be broken down to Self and Others because they are different skills. Ever since the upgrade to add the annoying Red Crisis Face, I cannot edit my entries or view the distress tolerance skills. So I have used this app for two weeks and now cannot access/use the data accurately for my appointment tomorrow. If reliability matters, don't use the free version of the app; I cannot speak to the reliability of the paid version.

I see potential. Needs better design and pricing. Will continue to use it to see how far I can go with free version. Also, needs someone to refresh the writing for a general audience. The video tour doesn't seem to work on my phone. Design is not intuitive. I had to figure it out by clicking around.
Like the app, but it doesn't save your entry more times than not. Very frustrating.

title: Chiku – Journal / Diary & Mood Tracker
description:
Introspect on daily events with self care journal to lead a happier life. We often find it
demanding to maintain a personal diary or mood journal and write about our
feelings. Yet, keeping our precious moments and memories safe for a lifetime is
what we aspire. Log your emotions and create a story anytime, anywhere using
Chiku – Personal Diary & Daily Mood Tracker.

Emotion Tracker
Give some time to yourself, for your well-being. Taking out a few minutes daily from
your busy, stressful schedule and just wondering about how your day was, is the key
to a healthy mind. Think about what made you feel happy and why something did
not. Log your emotions in the happiness tracker or reason about why your daily life
has become so stressful. Chiku is your personal assistant and emotion tracker to help you keep track of your day-to-day activities and inspire you along the way to
keep making your life better.

Mental Health Journal
Find your mental health score. We rate your daily mood and feelings to generate a
score averaged over a period of time, that tells how well you are keeping. Stay
elevated, keep a high score. Also, have a look at your top feelings, moods and
activities over the last few days.

Read Quote Of The Day
Get a daily dose of quotations, challenges, and questions. Start your day by reading
quote of the day that motivate you to achieve great things in life and guide you to live
a more meaningful life. Take Challenges that spark a competitive spirit in you and
feel a sense of accomplishment when you fulfil them. Explore the self care journal to
answer questions that force you to rise above petty issues and ponder over more
important stuff in life.

Mood Journal and Mood Diary
Get in-app blogs and be a part of the mood diary community. Connect with others
like you anonymously through our Community Platform. Share what you feel on
various topics with mood journal discussions. We believe that it’s easier to face
challenges in life when we have someone to talk to and get support from like-minded
people.

Self-care journal is available in 6 languages: English, Hindi, French, German, Italian
and Spanish.


Features of Chiku – Personal Diary & Daily Mood Tracker

★ Log your mood, feeling, activities and write about your day in mood journal.
★ Graphs & Interesting Insights to make mood diary more appealing
★ Configure reminders to create a story daily in self-care journal
★ Get a daily dose of motivation in the form of quotes, questions and challenges.
★ Increase your security by enabling emotion tracker app lock
★ Draw or add images and add them to your story
★ Use Happiness tracker to log your feelings
★ Read in app blogs and quote of the day about mental health
★ Join a community of like-minded people and mood journal keepers.
★ Multiple mood diary Themes to personalize your diary.
★ Dark mode available for mental health journal

Are you looking for a useful and life-changing self care journal app? 
The new emotion tracker and mental health journal is here for you. 

Download and use Chiku – Personal Diary & Daily Mood Tracker today!

comments: I payed for a month just to try it out fully. It's a very pleasing app to use, the ui looks very elegant and it actually feels like Chiku is asking me questions rather than me just ranting onto the paper. The o ly complaints I have are that it's going to be a massive pain to scroll to old stories and I feel as though the daily reads (for me) aren't too useful. Really great app! I'm considering buying the lifetime plan hoping this app doesn't get discontinued.

Very nice app. It's more than an app. It's a safe space🌌. Meditation is very nice. The quotes are very good of course!! Im in love with this app. The themes are all so good. Writing here is so easy!! Love it.
Easiest app to use. It is enough options to declare all your feelings and mood conditions, also, if you want you can add a written description about what's going on.
This app is amazing. I love how it reminds you to add a new story every day. Idk how to explain but everything is perfect.

I'd like to visit my previous entries with more ease. Please let me view them more easily without having to scroll sideways a lot. Also a go-to feature where you can find specific entries besides the filter would help. Also it would be nice to be able to save community blogs and daily quotes that inspired you. Maybe save them somewhere so you can access them any time. I also have experienced difficulty downloading the pdf versions of my entries.

title: My Online Therapy: Find Therapists & Counselling
description:
My Online Therapy is your very own virtual clinic with highly qualified psychologists. Get matched with a psychologist and choose how you get therapy or counselling - by video, live chat or daily coaching. Prices start from £49 for a session. 
 
IMPROVE YOUR WELLBEING EVERY DAY WITH OUR NEWEST FEATURE - SELF-CARE. Using evidence-based therapy skills and techniques written by psychologists, support your mental health alongside, or independent of, face-to-face video therapy. Start your 14-day free trial with an annual subscription, or try the 7-day free trial with a monthly subscription today!

Learn how to:
• Deal with difficult thoughts
• Calm your anxiety
• Get a good night’s sleep
• Build emotional intelligence
• Discover your purpose
• And much more

Get face-to-face therapy with a highly trained psychologist when and wherever's a good time to tap into you

Quality is what sets us apart. Our team of online therapists are all highly qualified psychologists and only deliver research-backed therapy in the style that best meets your lifestyle.

Everyone is unique which means we all respond to different approaches to therapy differently. Our matching algorithm combines 20+ years of clinical experience, matching you to the best online therapist or psychologist and type of therapy according to your specific needs, symptoms and circumstances. This ensures you get the result you’re looking for.

We believe in modern therapy for modern lives.

Our therapists

All of our online therapists are qualified psychologists and have been through a rigorous selection process. Many of our therapists also have long-standing academic and NHS careers, alongside their private work. They receive regular supervision from experts in their field and engage in a range of professional development and work to ensure they are always up to date with the most cutting edge, research-led therapies.

How we can help 

Our level of expertise means our online psychologist therapists can help with a wide range of mental health difficulties, including: depression, anxiety, PTSD, personality disorders, phobias, stress, health anxiety, social anxiety, panic attacks, work-related stress, bipolar disorder, eating disorders, self-harm, relationship difficulties, substance misuse, anorexia, binge-eating disorder, OCD.

Types of therapy 

Our focus is on providing cutting edge mental health therapies that deliver results, connecting you to qualified psychologists. This means we only offer therapies that are rooted in evidence-based practices and the best available research.

Online therapies include Acceptance & Commitment Therapy (ACT), Cognitive Analytic Therapy (CAT), Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT), Couples Therapy, Dialectical Behaviour Therapy (DBT), Dynamic Interpersonal Therapy, Eye Movement Desensitisation & Reprocessing Therapy, Mentalisation Based Therapy, Mindfulness-based Cognitive Therapy (MBCT), Narrative Therapy, Psychodynamic Therapy, Schema Therapy, Systemic Therapy.

Get started on your path to better in 4 simple steps 

Step 1 - Download the app and sign up

Step 2 - Complete our free online questionnaire by telling us a bit about yourself and your symptoms. We’ll match you to the best online therapists according to your personal needs.

Step 3 - Choose how you want to connect with your qualified therapists and get therapy (by video, live chat or daily coaching).

Step 4 - Start therapy! You can switch how you get therapy at any time.

---

Support

Telephone: 020 3349 7767 (available 9am-9pm Mon-Fri, 9am - 5pm Sat, 12am - 7pm Sun)
Email: support@myonlinetherapy.com

Privacy policy: https://myonlinetherapy.com/privacy-policy/
Terms of use: https://myonlinetherapy.com/terms-and-conditions/

summary: Speak to a therapist from £49 per session. Get anxiety & mental health support.
developer: Lekta Therapy | Talk to a therapist
developerAddress: 2 Lansdowne Row, Suite 163, London, W1J 6HL, United Kingdom
recentChanges: In the latest version, we've made some improvements to those using insurance as a payment method for therapy.
comments: The app in itself is good, and the price is certainly cheaper than a traditional therapist, but still too expensive for me I'm afraid. I think £50 for 30 minutes and £100 for 50 minutes is a bit of a scam. I had three sessions with my therapist, and had to stop because she was very slow and we still hadn't made any progress and I felt like I was losing my money... Not a great therapist either in my opinion, compared to others I talked to in the past. I didn't really feel understood, or heard.

This app looks great and really helpful for those who need it. But the costs are just too much, it excludes and marginalises those with little money. When most have no access to NHS offerings and no money for private this app offers false hope. Make the costs more obvious before people sign up. Going through emotional questions and 'connecting' with a therapist to then find out that it's like £49 for half an hour!?

Waaaaay to expensive. £99 per 50 minutes is ridiculous money. Don't waste your time. Look online at approved registers. You can get someone as qualified as people on this app for £70 per 60 minutes. Furthermore the app or my therpaists camera/ sound quality was terrible. I couldn't hear or see my therapist but then I contacted family after and it was fine. Good idea but not worth it at all.

This seems like a helpful app and I understand obviously why therapy is rather expensive. To improve it you could have an option for 13 or up or maybe even 5 and up with a parent. Although, I think when chosing a therapist you should have the therapists price range andcertain people may not feel comfortable with and may want to change. What I really liked was the audio tailored to your problem with the name of the therapist.

Poor service for me. You fill in a few automated drop down boxes to vaguely describe your problems and symptoms. Then you get allocated a therapist to choose from then before actually speaking to anyone you're expected to pay before you've spoken to anyone to work out treatment plans and unanswered questions. I called the help line they told me to contact the therapist and told me how the therapist returned my message 3 days last saying I need to call the helpline. Still not answered questions

title: Anxiety Test
description:
This Anxiety Test is designed to help you evaluate the severity of your anxiety with just seven simple questions. This app uses the Generalized Anxiety Questionnaire (GAD-7), an empirically-based, self-test questionnaire. It is also sensitive for other anxiety disorders as well such as specific phobia, panic disorder, and social phobia. These disorders generally respond positively to treatment, so it is important to seek treatment if you are concerned about your mental health.

DISCLAIMER: This self-test is not meant to be a diagnosis for your anxiety. Please consult your physician if you are concerned about your symptoms. This app should not be used as a replacement for professional treatment or guidance.


Privacy Policy: No data from this application is collected.

title: UP! Buddy - Bipolar Disorder Partner App
description:
Team up and fight bipolar, depression, BPD and anxiety.
UP! Buddy is the partner app of the UP! mood diary for individuals with mental health issues. Get to know the early warning signs and the mood triggers of your loved one even better. Learn to differentiate between normal and pathological mood swings, avoid interpersonal conflicts and provide help if really needed. Please note that UP! and UP! Buddy are two different apps. 

Getting started:
1. Download UP! Buddy
2. Generate a pairing code by using the entry "Buddies" within the UP! menu. Usually an UP! user invites a relative, friend or other confidants to participate by sending a pairing code
3. Enter the pairing code during the setup process of UP! Buddy
4. Done, the data will be synched periodically

Features:
• Mood calendar and mood chart view.
• Mood triggers: Sleep, work, physical- and social activity.
• Early warning signs of hypomania, mania and depression: A list of today’s and past observed warning signs as well as a description of all known warning signs.

The UP! user decides which category of diary entries is shared and is in control of the remote connection.

The buddy approach also helps to avoid overprotective behavior and supports the self-protection of care givers.
Only those who are and remain healthy can help.

Team up by using UP! and UP! Buddy.
If your loved one in need does not use UP! yet, recommend it and connect.

UP! is successfully used by individuals by people
• to keep track of bipolar I, bipolar 2 and cyclothymia.
• with rapid cycling bipolar.
• with mixed episodes.
• as depression journal when struggling with recurrent depression.
• with anxiety attacks and panic attacks.
• with borderline personality disorder (BPD).
• undergoing a burnout syndrome.

Take care and download now!

Your feedback matters to us! We need it to constantly improve the app.
Troubles, questions, suggestions, commendations and criticism - tell us: info@netural.com

title: Mental Health Nursing Test Prep 2020 Ed
description:
Mental Health Nursing Test Prep 

Key Features of this APP: 
• At practice mode you can see the explanation describing the correct answer.
• Real exam style full mock exam with timed interface
• Ability to create own quick mock by choosing the number of MCQ’s.
• You can create your profile and see your result history with just one click.
• This app contains large number of question set that covers all syllabus area.

MHNs act to bridge the gap between mental health services and general practice for patients suffering from acute to chronic mental illnesses. The role of an MHN has gradually transitioned over the years, to encompass a greater level of involvement in patient care e.g. nurses now have authority to prescribe medication.[5] The main responsibilities of a MHN can be subdivided into six broad categories with a certain degree of overlap:[6]

Case management: This consists of tailoring care to the specific needs of an individual. It involves providing interventions in the form of psychotherapy or familial support; arranging other services when required; establishing networks with community agencies; overseeing changes in medication; community integration and actively seeking out people who drop out of services.
Psychosocial interventions: A holistic approach to patient care is required, by which the MHN should build rapport with patients to encourage trust, while listening to and interpreting their needs and concerns. If a patient is having social/financial problems, the MHN may offer advice and interventions e.g. by arranging social events in the community, in order to develop patients’ socials skills and combat feelings of isolation. They may also work with patients' families and carers, helping to educate them about the burden of mental illness.
Physical health: Long-term mental illness sufferers may have substantial cardiometabolic/ respiratory illnesses.[7][8] Furthermore, this population is at considerable risk of contracting infections, such as HIV and AIDS.[9] The MHN will prepare and maintain comprehensive patient records, whilst also producing care plans and risk assessments. They must also monitor weight, blood pressure and provide health education and interventions in areas such as diet, smoking and sexual behaviour.
Medication management: MHN must ensure correct administration of medication, including injections, and monitoring the results of treatment.[2]
Working with dual diagnosis patients, and promoting a 'recovery' based approach to care.
Behavioural therapy: Providing evidence- based individual therapy e.g. cognitive behavioural therapy for depression and anxiety. Empathising with distressed patients and applying ‘de-escalation’ techniques to help patients manage their emotions and behaviour better. Encourage patients to take part in therapeutic hobbies such as art or drama.

It involves providing interventions in the form of psychotherapy or familial support; arranging other services when required; establishing networks with community agencies; overseeing changes in medication; community integration and actively seeking out people who drop out of services.
Psychosocial interventions: A holistic approach to patient care is required, by which the MHN should build rapport with patients to encourage trust, while listening to and interpreting their needs and concerns. If a patient is having social/financial problems, the MHN may offer advice and interventions e.g. by arranging social events in the community, in order to develop patients’ socials skills and combat feelings of isolation. They may also work with patients' families and carers, helping to educate them about the burden of mental illness.
Physical health: Long-term mental illness sufferers may have substantial cardiometabolic/ respiratory illnesses.[7][8] Furthermore, this population is at considerable risk of contracting infections, such as HIV and AIDS.[9] The MHN will prepare and maintain comprehensive patient records, whilst also producing care plans and risk assessments. They must also monitor weight, blood pressure and provide health education and interventions in areas such as diet, smoking and sexual behaviour.
Medication management: MHN must ensure correct administration of medication, including injections, and monitoring the results of treatment.[2]
Working with dual diagnosis patients, and promoting a 'recovery' based approach to care.
Behavioural therapy: Providing evidence- based individual therapy e.g. cognitive behavioural therapy for depression and anxiety. Empathising with distressed patients and applying ‘de-escalation’ techniques to help patients manage their emotions and behaviour better. Encourage patients to take part in therapeutic hobbies such as art or drama.
summary: Mental Health Nursing Test Prep
developerAddress: House# 657, Road 10, Mirpur DOHS, Dhaka 1216, Bangladesh.
recentChanges: Mental Health Nursing Test Prep 2019 Ed

title: De-StressMe: CBT Tools to Manage Stress
description:
De-StressMe brings personalized Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), Dialectical Behavioral Therapy (DBT), and self-care tools to your phone. Now you can manage stress, get stress relief, and improve mental health with the click of a button. And it's free!

De-StressMe has 3 primary features: 

1) Education about Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), Dialectical Behavioral Therapy (DBT), and self-care. Every day for 31 days at a time you choose, you will receive a brief, 10 second lesson. Each lesson is designed to be quick and easy to understand allowing you to reflect on the lesson the rest of the day. These lessons also teach you how to use the app more effectively.

2) Stress management and preparation for future stressful situations. You can set self-care goals, reflect on personal strengths, count the positives in your life, write about your day in a Mood Diary, and create coping cards to keep yourself centered and balanced. 

3) Stress relief when you need it most. Just click the De-StressMe button and the statements you wrote to manage stress and the questions you answered in the tutorial get transformed and used for relaxation, stress relief, and improved mental health.

Free features include:
• Personalized Cognitive Behavioral Therapy tools to manage stress. Includes over 12 different CBT techniques to center you when you need it most such as distress scales, credit lists, deep breathing and relaxation, imagery techniques, self-care goals, and more.
• 31 high-impact, ten second lessons for learning self-care, coping skills, relaxation techniques, and CBT theories.
• Sections for writing self-care ideas, things you are thankful for, personal strengths and coping cards to keep you centered. These entries are also used to improve the de-stressing tool’s effectiveness to maximize stress relief.
• A mood diary for journaling about your day and mood.
• Reminders to attend to self-care, social supports, and emotional wellness.
• Password entry for your diary with a back-up security question to keep your information secure from prying eyes.
• Suicide hotline number for calling and texting at high stress levels.
• All of your information stays on your phone. De-StressMe does not take data from your phone.
• And most importantly, no Ads! So nothing interferes with you getting your stress relief when you need it. 

For a limited time, premium features included free: 
• 10+ bonus 10 second lessons based on Acceptance Commitment Therapy.
• Over 35 pre-filled coping cards to help you cope with difficult situations such as problems at work, keeping boundaries around toxic people, and difficult changes in life.
• Over 100 self-care ideas based on embracing your creativity, relaxing, being active, and being social.
• Over 100 statements for giving thanks ranging from simple things to grandiose statements about life and success.
• Over 100 individual strength ideas, inherent and physical strengths.
• The ability to favorite and edit these coping cards, self-care ideas, personal strengths, and affirmations of thanks. This dramatically cuts down on the time you spend typing.

Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) has been found to be one of the most effective therapies to manage stress, strengthen coping skills, and improve mental health in a myriad of medical and psychological studies. However, therapy is expensive and there are often few options for good therapists in many parts of the world. De-StressMe makes therapy skills available to everyone. 

Your feedback is great for helping us achieve our goal of helping the most people. Please rate, comment, and share.

This app should not be used to replace therapy or medication for people with untreated or uncontrolled mental illness. It is not a medical treatment.

De-StressMe provides simple Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), Dialectical Behavioral Therapy (DBT), and self-care tools for managing stress, stress relief, and improving mental health.

https://www.facebook.com/DeStressM3/

recentChanges: Badges section updated.
comments: This has been a great app, it's especially useful when you're having an anxiety attack and you can't help yourself or have anyone to go to. Even if things escalate (suicidal ideation, self-harm etc) it still provides help and resources.

I have a VERY HIGH stress level.This app helps with calming my anxiety,looking at things in a more positive light,and is just THE BEST all around app that is FREE and HELPFUL.TRY IT-you'll love it,too!!!

De-stress Me is a mental well-being app based on cognitive-behavioral (CBT) techniques. I am currently a graduate student in psychology, and as such, I used this app with a discerning eye. The first time I opened the app I was greeted by a rather minimal interface with several options on the bottom of the screen, and a big de-stressMe button in the center. The options along the bottom allow you to input information including your strengths, ways to give thanks, and self-care ideas. The information that you input is used when you activate the de-stressing tool. One of the primary components of CBT is cognitive restructuring which entails challenging negative and automatic thoughts. The app cleverly integrates the information that you input into the bottom menus in order to assist you in challenging negatively oriented thoughts that you may experience during times of stress. Additionally, the app may suggest a technique that I am familiar with from my training, diaphragmatic breathing. The app does a good job of teaching and applying the basic tenants of both strategies. Overall, the app was helpful in reducing my stress and is based on sound psychological principles. I would recommend this app to anyone looking for a convenient and cost-effective way to reduce stress in their life.
Lovely, well designed and effective app. A must for those prone to stress and anxiety. Particularly love the images of progressing up a mountain in de-stress mode.
This app is really helping me! It seems simple but is highly effective the more a person practices with it. I'm glad this app is available and is free!

title: Dealing with Depression
description:
Depression is an extreme low mood that lasts a long time and makes a person feel sad,
irritable or empty. Many people, including many teens, have suffered in this way. A
depressed person:
^ has much less energy to do activities
^ feels like nothing matters.
^ sees life in a negative way.
^ feels like it will never get better
But depressed people do get better and depression does end. There are effective
treatments and self-help skills to deal with depression. Health care professionals give
depression treatments, but you can learn self help skills and apply them to your own life. This guide teaches a set of antidepressant skills you can use to overcome depression. Sometimes the skills can be used on their own, when the depression
isn’t too severe. Sometimes they have to be used along with treatments by professionals.
Dealing with Depression is meant for those who have been coping with depressed mood. Some of the things in this guide will make more sense to younger teens and some will make more sense to older ones. But check it out for yourself. Decide which parts of this guide make sense for your life.
This Depression Test is designed to help you evaluate the severity of your depression with just nine simple questions. This app uses the Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9), an empirically-based, self-test questionnaire. Clinical depression is a mood disorder in which feelings of sadness, loss, anger, or frustration interfere with everyday life for weeks or longer. Clinical depression generally responds positively to treatment, so it is important to seek treatment if you are concerned about your mental health.
 DISCLAIMER: This self-test is not meant to be a diagnosis for your depression. Remember that this app should not be used as a replacement for professional treatment or guidance.
Do you suffer from depression? Depression may stem from a personal tragedy or from sad unexpected events or circumstances. It does not discriminate its victims. Depression can affect anyone regardless of their background, race, age, income, etc.
The natural management of depression involves understanding depression and the factors that contribute to the symptoms. Learning to manage stress in your life and engage in self-care behaviors can improve your symptoms and your mood.
Depression is one of the most prevalent and treatable mental disorders. Diagnosis of depression is based on the presence of certain symptoms that significantly impair function for a certain duration. These symptoms are described in the DSM-IV, the diagnostic manual for mental disorders. 
This app is designed to help with Depression treatment and controlling stress by advising mood enhancing foods, teaching the importance of writing wellness journals and how to get adequate sleep during depressive episodes.
Dealing with Depression app is an app that helps you diagnose the level of depression you have, and based on that it gives you the suitable solution for your depression level, in some cases depression is only a result of anxiety and some passing problems, but if the person did not get out of that condition then his condition might advance, we will give you some ways to avoid the advancement of your situation, if the depression is severe we will guide you to what to do as soon as possible
Depression is common but many people don't admit to it. Some people feel there is a stigma attached, or that people will think they are weak. Great leaders such as Winston Churchill have had depression. Depression is one of the most common illnesses that GPs deal with. People with depression may be told by others to "pull their socks up" or "snap out of it". The truth is, they cannot and such comments by others are very unhelpful.
Depression (major depressive disorder) is a common and serious medical illness that negatively affects how you feel, the way you think and how you act. Fortunately, it is also treatable. Depression causes feelings of sadness and/or a loss of interest.

recentChanges: Bug Fixes
comments: The writing is very, shall we say, "colloquial" l but the content is spot on and straight to the point. This app is practical, easy to read, useful and positive. A very cost-effective alternative to a life coach! I think this app will also appeal to teenagers who might be put off but a more "serious" format and style of writing. Available in all formats so accessible to all. Free with Kindle Audio trial I believe.

I found this app at the right time. Consider all going on during unprecedented times and consider reading this app. Great tips mentioned to help cope with my depression. I am fond of the idea that the author gave the reader the chance to interact. I feel like there are things I can take from this to help. Pleased with the app.

Dealing with Depression is an awesome app for anyone dealing with depression. The author provided a self care process that’s effective and easy to follow. So many forget that self care is a must. The self care activities provided ways to help you acknowledge and incorporate new routines in your daily routines.

I've battled depression all of my life. I've had more success with rising above depression with the solutions in this app than I have with medication and therapy combined. It makes so much sense, and the solutions are real life tools people can use and apply for quick, sustainable results. Reading this app has changed my life for the better.
A really good list of things and the right information to deal with situation. I have even recommended this app to a friend of mine who appreciated work done by the team. Good work.

title: Bipolar Disorder
description: Bipolar disorder, previously known as manic depression, is a mental disorder that causes periods of depression and periods of elevated mood. The elevated mood is significant and is known as mania or hypomania, depending on its severity, or whether symptoms of psychosis are present. During mania, an individual behaves or feels abnormally energetic, happy, or irritable. Individuals often make poorly thought out decisions with little regard to the consequences. The need for sleep is usually reduced during manic phases. During periods of depression, there may be crying, a negative outlook on life, and poor eye contact with others. The risk of suicide among those with the illness is high at greater than 6 percent over 20 years, while self-harm occurs in 30–40 percent. Other mental health issues such as anxiety disorders and substance use disorder are commonly associated.

title: Depression - Mental Health Awareness
description:
Depression (major depressive disorder or clinical depression) is a common but serious mood disorder. It causes severe symptoms that affect how you feel, think, and handle daily activities.It is more than just feeling sad, upset or unmotivated from time to time, but depression is way more serious. 

It is a mood disorder characterized by prolonged feelings of sadness and loss of interest in daily activities. If these symptoms persist for a period of at least two weeks, it is considered you've diagnose with major depressive disorder.

Find out on what cause depression, the risk factor, sign & symptoms and the treatments and prevention step to be taken from it to re-occurring by download this essential mental health info awareness app!

App Features:
- 100% free to download.
- No In-app purchases needed.
- User friendly app navigation and design.
- Lightweight app design and required small storage space to install.
- Share function ready to spread this awareness among your friends and family trough your favorite social media app platform.

App Contain:
- Overview: Explaination & type of depression.
- Sign & Symptoms: Sign and Symptoms of what occur depression.
- Risk Factor: What major cause of this major depressive disorder
- Treatments: Treatments and prevention step for this mental health disorder.
- Great info-graphic included for more graphical information.

Remember, Prevention is better than cure. That is why it is essential for us gain awareness and deeper understanding on depression before it getting serious that potentially lead to suicide.

title: Mental Health
description:
"What Is Mental Health?

Mental health includes our emotional, psychological, and social well-being. It affects how we think, feel, and act. It also helps determine how we handle stress, relate to others, and make choices. Mental health is important at every stage of life, from childhood and adolescence through adulthood.

Over the course of your life, if you experience mental health problems, your thinking, mood, and behavior could be affected. Many factors contribute to mental health problems, including:

Biological factors, such as genes or brain chemistry
Life experiences, such as trauma or abuse
Family history of mental health problems
Mental health problems are common but help is available. People with mental health problems can get better and many recover completely.

Early Warning Signs
Not sure if you or someone you know is living with mental health problems? Experiencing one or more of the following feelings or behaviors can be an early warning sign of a problem:

Eating or sleeping too much or too little
Pulling away from people and usual activities
Having low or no energy
Feeling numb or like nothing matters
Having unexplained aches and pains
Feeling helpless or hopeless
Smoking, drinking, or using drugs more than usual
Feeling unusually confused, forgetful, on edge, angry, upset, worried, or scared
Yelling or fighting with family and friends
Experiencing severe mood swings that cause problems in relationships
Having persistent thoughts and memories you can't get out of your head
Hearing voices or believing things that are not true
Thinking of harming yourself or others
Inability to perform daily tasks like taking care of your kids or getting to work or school"

title: DrJulian Mental Health
description:
Try therapy on your sofa, not the therapist’s.

Dr Julian is the award-winning digital therapy app used by hundreds of people every day. It is the one place you can turn to for mental health support that provides online video counselling with experienced therapists, counsellors and psychotherapists.

Well done, you have taken the first step towards the road to recovery! Seeking help with stress, anxiety, depression or other mental health issues is often the hardest move and Dr Julian ensures that the next steps you take are easy.

With the Dr Julian app for mental health care, you can have video, audio, or  live chat therapy with trusted therapists from the comfort of your own home, or a similar comfortable space.

The Dr Julian app handles all stages of the booking process. We offer a helping hand in choosing your therapist, picking the date and time and method of communication, and booking the appointment.

What’s New?

-	Take part in a range of mental health assessments to determine your level of treatment, all licensed by the NHS
-	A free standardised questionnaire to assess your level of anxiety or depression
-	Have the option of video, audio or chat appointments, each session taking place on the app
-	Search a large database of therapists to find one that matches your specific needs, or use the Dr Julian Match Service

Our therapists are highly trained and experienced in online counselling. They are part of the Dr Julian app to support a wide range of mental health issues.

It is free to download the Dr Julian app. Once you have downloaded the app, register your details confidentially, choose your therapist and the best date available for you, and sit back and relax.

Why Dr Julian?

At Dr Julian we believe everyone should have easy, inexpensive access to qualified therapists. Professional therapy should be available in a place that is comfortable and convenient for you.

This is your treatment, for you. Make it the session you deserve.

Our therapists are highly trained and experienced in online counselling. They are part of the Dr Julian app to support a wide range of mental health issues.

It is free to download the Dr Julian app. Once you have downloaded the app, register your details confidentially, choose your therapist and the best date available for you, and sit back and relax.

Why Dr Julian?

At Dr Julian we believe everyone should have easy, inexpensive access to qualified therapists. Professional therapy should be available in a place that is comfortable and convenient for you.

This is your treatment, for you. Make it the session you deserve.
summary: The Dr Julian mobile application for accessing Mental Health support
recentChanges: Bug fixes and performance improvements.

title: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy - CBT
description:
There is something in all of us that responds involuntarily to different stressors and the complexity of life which is suggested be the fundamental problem of all mental illnesses. It grows and thrives as a consequence, goes beyond tolerance, making our lives miserable. Lives are complicated and we cannot stay on top of our problems all the time. People are just being hammered in many ways and that lead to their collapse in the direction of their genetic susceptibility and biological weakness.

The CBT app is developed as a tool for introspection and will provide you with evidence-based information about emotional problems and mental disorders. It will teach you cognitive behavioural therapy and other self-help methods, and techniques, specifically designed to help with overcoming depression, generalized anxiety and worry, social anxiety and shyness, divorce and separation, loss and bereavement. It will help you test yourself, identify your problems and bring order in your life by tackling your negative thoughts and habits.

The CBT app provides practices, examples, and exercises that will help you assess and understand the roots of your worries and teach you how to suppress your negative thinking. Cognitive behavioural therapy is proven to be effective in the long term by applying the techniques and shift the way you think. It can help you find a meaning and purpose, negotiate with yourself and be free from your past. 

“Such as are your habitual thoughts, such also will be the character of your mind;
For the soul is dyed by the thoughts.” Marcus Aurelius

•	In the Depression section, you will learn more about psychological, medical and alternative treatments for relief, reduction, prevention and dealing with major depressive disorders, dysthymia, bipolar disorder. By using the self-help methods you can learn helpful ways of thinking, that will help overcome depression now and in the future. It will also help you to practice ways of living your life and relating to people that leave you less vulnerable to depression.

•	In the Anxiety and Worry (GAD) section you will have the opportunity to learn more about anxiety and worry and whether you are a worrier. A helpful set of strategies will show you how to deal with the purpose, meaning, and content of your worries. And, at the end, you will have a different perspective on how to manage it. The program will help you tackle your mental habits, address your feelings and practice different behaviors.

•	In the Social Anxiety section, you will have the opportunity to learn more about social anxiety and how to overcome shyness, reassess your predictions about how things turn out for you and challenge the way you interpret others' responses to you. This program will teach you practical attention strategies to decrease your self-consciousness, social exposure exercises, and some social communication tips.

•	In the Divorce and Separation section, you will learn about specific coping skills practices and training and helpful general practical advice. Along the way, it is worth remembering that the process of recovery from separation and divorce takes time, sometimes a long time. Rather than judge yourself for not going fast enough, it is important to give yourself credit for any small steps you make to help yourself or your children adjust to the changes.

•	In the Bereavement and Loss section, you'll find information about grief and loss, including what is actually happening when we experience grief, common emotional reactions to loss, and unhelpful myths and expectations about grief. Although it's not possible to turn back the clock or remove the fact of a loss, you may find some of these ideas are useful for helping with your grief.

*The app is not designed to treat clinical levels of depression or anxiety, or other mental health disorders. Further counseling is needed as the diagnosis and treatment require a medical practitioner or a qualified mental health professional.

comments: It literally said that divorce may make you sad "like glue that has hardened to a fixture and trying to unglue it." Yeah. Ugh Just get the original CBT book "Feeling Good"

A lot of info, some of it I don't agree with. I wish there was a more hands-on side to the techniques suggested. Also, there is no mention of ACT (3rd wave CBT) at all...

title: FyxIt: Therapy Method for Mental Health
description:
By implementing this application you will understand that we create an experience with what we pay attention to, what we see, hear, feel ... we create an internal representation of external events through mental images, internal voices, sounds and feelings, therefore these events are neither good nor bad we already give them meaning by the way we look at them.

By working through this proven therapeutic method you will 100% relieve yourself from any psychological hardships you are going through and make your mood better for decisions, planning, etc...

Using this therapy app on every kind of psychological problem will better your life and increase your overall happiness and mental health. It is very simple and free. You can use it infinite number of times and still have same therapeutic results. 

The simplicity of the app is where it shines. So to finally fix those problems you were having start using this every time you have one and you will see the results. Your confidence will boost your self-love will boost through this self-help app and will increase your mindfulness.

title: Mental Health
description:
Mental Health

Prizewinning investigative journalist Art Levine offers a no-holds-barred and crucial call to action for America's broken mental health system.The mental health system in America is hardly a front-burner issue, despite lip-service about reform after a tragic mass killing. Yet every American should care deeply about fixing a system a presidential commission reported was in "shambles." By some measures, about 20 percent of Americans have some sort of mental health condition, including the most vulnerable among us-veterans, children, the elderly, prisoners, and the homeless. With Mental Health, Inc., award-winning investigative journalist Art Levine delivers a Shock Doctrine-style expose of the failures of our out-of-control, profits-driven mental health system, with a special emphasis on the failures of the pharmaceuticals industry, including the treatment of children with antipsychotics and disastrous PTSD protocols for veterans.Levine provides narrative portraits of victims and people who won unexpected victories against their illnesses by getting smart, personalized help, as well as snapshots of corrupt Big Pharma executives and researchers who created fraudulent marketing schemes. Levine also tells the dramatic David vs. Goliath stories of a few brave reformers, including Harvard-trained psychiatrist and researcher Dr. Stefan Kruszewski, who has acted as a whistle-blower in numerous cases, leading to major federal and state settlements, as well as spotlighting pioneering clinicians challenging outmoded, drug-and-sedate practices that leave 90 percent of people with serious mental illness too disabled to work.By taking a comprehensive look at mental health abuses and dangerous, ineffective practices as well as pointing toward solutions for creating a system for effective, proven, and compassionate care, Art Levine's essential Mental Health, Inc. is a call to action for politicians and citizens alike.

title: Mood Time Pro - Mood Tracker, Mental Health
description:
This Easy, Mood-Tracking App helps you overcome mood issues, so that you can have a life worth living! Finding the right Mental Health App is tiring, and it leaves us feeling overwhelmed with all the choices. It shouldn't be this hard to find a straightforward mental health app! We feel your pain. As a therapist for over 10 years, I have helped many clients struggling with mental health issues. Therapist have science-based ways that we track progress over time, and none of the apps get it right. Finally, I created this app to help you get there. 

Follow These Simple Steps:
1. Download the App
2. Track Your Mood Each Day
3. Enjoy tracking your progress and/or share with a therapist.
4. Experience a more peaceful and happy life! 

What Are the Benefits?
-AD-FREE
-Easy and Simple to Use
-Daily Reminders to Track Your Mood
-Calculates the Intensity of Emotion 
-Tracks the Number of Hours You're Feeling Down
-Shareable Data to so that You and your Therapist can have the Best Information

It would be difficult to know how much you are progressing in therapy without the Mood Time App. If you have a therapist, they will need to spend valuable time asking questions or filling out annoying questionnaires. Wasting time is the last thing you want to do during a counseling session. 

You don't have to feel overwhelmed when battling the negativity that life throws at you. With the Mood Time App, you can be the kind of person who lives a fulfilling and happy life. Download the App Today!

title: Mindshine: Mindfulness Coach
description:
Mindshine is your digital coach for a healthy mind. We've designed it to make you feel amazing, and get you moving in the right direction to thrive. Get started for free and start becoming the person you’ve always wanted to become. 

MUCH MORE THAN JUST A MEDITATION APP
Do you want to have more self confidence and motivation? Would you like to have more self love, gratitude and feel in general more positive and happier? Do you want to reach your goals and learn how you can stay calm in stressful situations? Whatever of the above it is, your mindset and daily routines are the keys for your mental health and growth. Mindshine is your personal coach that helps you train your mind holistically and find balance in life. 

THE BEST MENTAL FITNESS TECHNIQUES ALL IN ONE PLACE
Get on the fast-track to personal growth with the best techniques from positive psychology, mindfulness and leadership coaching.  

SUSTAINABLE PROGRESS IN JUST 10 MINUTES A DAY
Feel the motivating power of "micro-steps". Get guided through science-based exercises that are short, simple and fun.

TAILORED TO YOUR GOALS & NEEDS
Personalised exercises that are designed to fit you & your active lifestyle.  Pick up your smartphone and train anywhere at any time.

Whether you are looking to find your why, increase your overall mood and happiness or improve your sleep - Mindshine guides you towards reaching your personal growth goals. 

UNLEASH YOUR FULL GROWTH POTENTIAL AND GET ACCESS TO
+170 effective training sessions designed by experts for your personal goals.
+13 training plans for your growth
+15 hours high fidelity audio snippets, guiding and coaching you along interactive exercises.
Guided meditation for more gratitude and as a stress relief.
Fresh, new training content every month.
Relax, find your calm and fall asleep faster with high quality sleep.
A life long companion for your mental health.

WHY MINDSHINE IS JUST RIGHT FOR YOU
- Value for money - Increased mental fitness and strength for a weekly price of less than a coffee.
- It supports you in taking small daily steps that soon will add up to big changes. 
- Much more than just a meditation app or positive affirmations app. Compared to Apps, such as   Headspace, Calm App, 7 Mind or Insight Timer, Mindshine shows you a holistic world of proven techniques, all in one app. 
- Accessible for anyone at any time. 
- Save time - Short and effective training sessions that take between 5 to max. 15 minutes.
- Stay Motivated - Daily doses of inspiration and features like personal playlists and statistics help you build positive habits.


APP USAGE & SUBSCRIPTION
Download and usage of Mindshine is free of charge. Full access to the whole training library is part of the yearly subscription. If you go for the subscription, you pay the price that was set for your country, which is shown in the app. The subscription is automatically renewed unless you cancel it at least 24 hours before the end of the 12 months period. Your account is being charged with each new subscription period at some point within 24 hours before your subscription expires. The current subscription period cannot be cancelled. At any time, you can deactivate the automatic renewal in your settings. 

FURTHER INFORMATION:
Terms of Service: https://www.mindshine.app/terms-of-service/
Privacy Policy: https://www.mindshine.app/privacy-policy/

title: WorryTree: Anxiety Relief - CBT Self-Help Tool
description:
Identify your worries, anxiety and negative thoughts, take action and transform your thinking so you feel calmer and less anxious. WorryTree helps you do all of this based on established Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT) techniques. 

*Now featured on the NHS Digital App Library*

"This is the best app honestly for anxiety or obsessive thinking. It's very simple and has a calm design and gives the user a feeling of empowerment in their life." 

We've created a very simple, easy to use and practical app that will support you through the problem-solving process helping you either to make a plan to deal with your worry, or find in-the-moment distractions to help you cope.

WorryTree is for you if: 

- You're looking for a simple, practical and easy to use app to manage your worry, panic and anxiety 
- You want to be able to make a plan for dealing with a situation you're worrying or feeling stressed about
- You struggle to remember what helps you to feel calm when you're feeling anxious
- You're committed to changing your thought habits for the benefit of your mental health

WorryTree is not: 

- A substitute for professional mental health care
- A complex app with lots of layers and clever algorithms - we've designed it to be very simple so that it's easy to use when you're feeling anxious or panicky
- A magician - Real habit change will only happen if you commit to regularly catching, recording and problem solving your worries, but we'll do our best to support you  
- Built by a faceless app development company - we're a family-run UK business created by anxiety sufferers with a genuine wish to help others who struggle with worry
- Just an app - we're building a supportive community for users and via our blog too

"This app is so simple, wonderful and functional at the same time. When I am worrying about something, I just write it on this app, and then I feel much better."

**If you love WorryTree then you'll love subscribing to WorryTree Plus too!** 

WorryTree Plus brings all of the basic features of WorryTree, plus some extras too! Use our uncertainty tool to work through any uncertainties that you're struggling with, go back and review your worries after the event, consider your negative thinking styles and add your action plans to your own calendar. You can even now use WorryTree as a Gratitude Journal! 

Your subscription to WorryTree Plus enables us to keep the basic version of WorryTree free forever for people who can't afford to pay. It also allows us to invest more money into improving WorryTree for all of our users and to keep our app advertising free, so it's always this simple to use. 

After you choose either our monthly or annual subscription plan and confirm your purchase, the payment will be charged to your credit or debit card via your Google Play Account. Once purchased, subscriptions will automatically renew unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period.

You can read our Terms and Conditions in full at https://worry-tree.com/terms-conditions. 

**WorryTree is not a substitute for professional mental health care, therapy or advice. If you're worried about any aspect of your mental health, or someone else's, you should always approach a professional.**

recentChanges: Welcome to your new improved WorryTree with some big changes based on your feedback! You asked to be able to schedule worry time and so we've added that to our Settings. You also asked if you could save your worries for later and so we've added that too. And with a seven day trial for WorryTree Plus you can try some of our extra features for free! As always with a big release like this, we'd encourage you to get in touch at hello@worry-tree.com if you have any problems with this new update.
comments: I like the fact you can add a PIN. The UI is also amazing. I love the concept of this app and how simple it is to use. Custom categories are also a really good feature. I don't really have any criticism for this app, other than that it could maybe do with some more features? Like maybe some small things such as changing the colour scheme or background of the app?

This is the best app honestly for anxiety or obsessive thinking. It's very simple and has a calm design and gives the user a feeling of empowerment in their life. It would be nice if it had features in the side menu like gratitude, guided audios, sleep sounds/or a panic button for relaxation breathing like some competitor apps have. I am close to making this one my main app but I was sold on the relax/panic button with breathing exercise visuals in the other apps.
App crashes on load every time

Kindly add a box named "What can you do about it" above the "what are you going to do about it" box because it encourages brainstorming and shows us our available options to handle the worry. Good app overall
This is like a "worry workbook". Incredibly helpful and reminds me of therapy sessions where the therapist listens to you articulate what's bothering you and develop a plan to help solve it.

title: Happiful
description:
Happiful Magazine is devoted to mental health and wellbeing. With our brand new app you can:

* Read the latest issues of Happiful Magazine wherever you go
* Follow the latest news with daily health and wellbeing articles from our team of writers and contributors
* Connect with professional support from our family of 20,000+ counsellors, therapists and other wellness professionals

We offer professional perspectives, actionable self-help strategies, inspirational true stories and interviews with high profile individuals, all with a focus on mental health and wellbeing. 

This app will also help you find the help you need right now. Happiful has over 20,000 mental health and wellbeing professionals listed and contactable through our app and you can reach out to counsellors, therapists, life coaches, nutritionists and hypnotherapists in your area, today.

What is 'positive mental health'?

Positive mental health is the acknowledgement that we all have mental health and some of us will live with or encounter mental illness - but that mental health should never be a subject associated with shame or the need for secrecy.

Positive mental health is about sharing access to help,  pro-actively seeking support and practising the type of self-care that is applicable to you. It's about developing a caring, collaborative community who support each other while being mindful, and respectful, of their individual mental health needs.

Happiful is on a mission to de-stigmatise any idea that taking care of your mental health, mental illness and wellbeing is something to be ashamed of, so that our readers can take steps to living happier, healthier and more fulfilled lives.

comments: Love this music, it made me feel calm after a long hot day!
Installed several times but when clicking on app, it reamians stuck at the opening page. Won't respond at all. I've uninstalled and reinstalled it mulitple times but continues to remain stuck.

Brilliant mag made even better with the app! There is so much in this magazine I struggle to read it before the next issue. Great to dip in and out of, amazing insights given by the wonderful people who share their very personal stories. The app makes it so much easier to read and I love the fact that I have access to back issues. Thanks so much happiful, keep up the great work!
This app logs me out every time I close it. Very annoying.
Love this magazine, i get paper copies also.

title: Mind Ease: Anxiety Relief
description:
“It felt great knowing I had somewhere to turn when I was nervous or upset. It helped a lot to know that I could consistently help myself feel better, and that gave me a sense of confidence that improved my day-to-day tension.”

Meet Mind Ease, the growing anxiety relief self-care app that has been proven to reduce negative feelings in 91% of uses.

Helping you take charge of your own mental health and wellbeing, we have collected the most clinically proven, science-backed techniques that will reduce your anxiety, stress and tension in 7 minutes - as well as improving your mood. 

Feel better with Mind Ease: we tailor our exercises to your needs and use the latest research to bring you short 7-minute exercises that will help you to feel calm and reduce stress. Endorsed by psychologists and other mental health professionals, Mind Ease is growing as a leading stress-reduction app. 

HOW DOES MIND EASE WORK?

Open the Mind Ease app when you’re feeling stressed, anxious, or worried and tap on the Calm Me button to start a quick anxiety-reducing exercise. 
Mind Ease helps you mindfully reflect on how you’re feeling at the moment, walks you through an easy stress-relief exercise, and logs your feelings after the exercise to improve your customized anxiety-reduction program for the future.

Each exercise is explained before you begin, so you will always understand what’s coming next and how the app is working to reduce your anxiety, and improve your mood. 

Mind Ease’s Explore page has a range of tools, activities and guides that help you to understand some of the causes and mechanisms behind anxious feelings and negative thoughts. You can use these to build up your awareness of how to care for your mental health, as well as to plan for how you might manage stressful situations in the future. 

HOW IS MIND EASE CUSTOMIZED FOR ME?

With your own personalized account, you have full control over your profile, what exercises are shown to you, what reassuring messages you see on the home page, and more.
By tracking your level of anxiety before and after each exercise, you are also able to view your progress and record which exercises are the most helpful for you. Because each person’s experience is unique, Mind Ease learns which exercises work the best for you, and offers a customized range of exercises to better help you in the future. 

HOW DOES MIND EASE HELP ME GET BETTER AND REDUCE MY ANXIETY?

The Mind Ease Insights page tracks your progress and shows you trends over time which exercises are best for you. Your recent exercise history shows how much your mood has improved for each time you used the app, so you can easily reflect on when Mind Ease helped the most.
These insights also track your reduction in negative feelings and overall mood improvement statistics, so you can see how well Mind Ease has worked since Day One.

WHAT MAKES MIND EASE WORK SO WELL FOR ITS USERS?

Mind Ease leads the way in anxiety relief by using evidence-based exercises that are used in clinical settings, and help a wide range of people who are struggling with anxiety. Our exercises help reduce anxiety symptoms and negative emotions quickly and reliably - an empowering system of self-care and stress relief, when you need it. 

Our results are powerful and evidence based - our users report they feel better 91% of the time after using our app. Mind Ease is one of the few apps that tracks improvement in feelings with each use - providing valuable information about which exercises work best for you, and how much you are improving. 

WHAT EXERCISES DOES MIND EASE HAVE?

We only include the most clinically proven and recognized exercises supported by therapists and psychologists. Exercises include:
• Progressive Muscle Relaxation
• Deep Breathing Visualisation
• Mindfulness Meditation
• Anxiety Defusion
• Cognitive Therapy
• Visualization
• Reflective Writing
• Positive Reappraisal
• Gratitude Journaling
• DARE Response
… and more.

recentChanges:
Mind Ease 1.41
• Overhauled the introduction process
• Added the Know Your Attachment Style activity to Explore
• Made improvements to many of our Quick Reads
• Defusion exercise now has voiceover narration
• Made Know Your Triggers exercise free for all users
• Fixed odd behaviour with some of the Sign In options

comments: This app is quiet helpful. At first when I tried the app I wasnt taking it seriously but when I opened up to it to see if it would help it has helped me a bit. I have really bad anxiety, generalized/health anxiety and majority of the time I forget to get on the app but when I do I feel more relieved and have my thoughts more collected than out of control all over the place. I dont pay the app for special exercises or anything and it good.

They say the free version has several exercises, but when I entered my mood info, a message said, 'you aren't having negative thoughts so try one of our many activities.' But ALL activities were locked. And ALL 'Guides' were locked. There were no exercises for me to use. How can I decide to go Premium if I can't try anything in the free version first? I don't like giving low ratings before contacting the developer first - but I could not find any contact info anywhere - another pet peeve.

It's not accurate to say you have a choice of exercises. Unless you pay, you get one exercise, whether it's one you like or not. The exercises are nice, but this app has nothing BUT its 11 exercises, and charges as much as apps with a whole library of meditations and tools. It's enjoyable to use but they are asking a ridiculous price for so little content compared to the competitors.

I got mind ease early and was gifted a full subscription! I really enjoy the full experience and It has helped me manage my anxiety really well. The calm me function is really cool and helps give you an experience tailored to what you're feeling without you having to pick it in your moment of panic which is a great feature. I hope by this time next year I will financially be able to continue my subscription because it is well worth the money imo!

I was halfway through the very first pre exercise and I felt so much better. Towards the end I had a slight emotional release, which was very much needed and I am still genuinely surprised. I cannot wait to dive deeper into this app. Thank you so much for creating this, it is truly going to help a lot of people!

title: WeAreMore: Find a Therapist + Free Peer Support
description:
Find-a-Therapist: Easily find your perfect Therapist. Transparent pricing, confirmed availability, distance from you measurement, Online and in-person options. Filter therapists based on Cost, Distance, Specialty, Languages etc.

Find the best-rated Therapists in your neighborhood or Virtual. Your choice. No Contracts, no commitments. Try a therapist and get 50% off the first visit. 

Support App built exclusively for mental and chronic disease patients. Recommended by Mental health America, crisis hotlines, and over 100 doctor offices in the country. 

Find a Therapist: Find therapists in your neighborhood or virtual with ease. Sort listings based on Rates, Specializations, Distance, Languages, and more. Get 50% off the first session for any therapist. 
PLUS
Get support from peers who understand your health conditions. Get motivated with Gratitude posts. Share & search for peer-recommended doctors and hospitals. Express yourself with creative highlights about your health. Tons of other features keep you engrossed in an empathetic environment.  

Addiction support groups: (smoking, addiction, alcohol, opioids)
Mental health support groups: (PTSD, Borderline Personality Disorder, Depression, Anxiety, Schizophrenia, Bipolar disorder, addiction, eating disorder)
Diabetes support groups: (T1D, T2D, Pre-diabetes)
Cancer support groups: (Breast cancer, Prostate cancer, Skin cancer, Colon cancer, Lung cancer, Brain cancer, Leukemia, Lymphoma, Ovarian, other cancer) 
Cardiac (Heart disease, Heart failure)
Chronic Pain support groups: (Fibromyalgia, Lupus (SLE), Arthritis, Crohn's/colitis, Neuropathy)
Neurologic (Alzheimer’s, Dementia, Parkinson’s, ALS, MS, Migraine, Seizures, Stroke)
Relationship chat groups: (Marital, Family)
Pediatric support groups: (Parenting, Autism, ADHD, Cerebral Palsy, Cystic Fibrosis)
HIV & Hepatitis C support groups: (HIV, Hep C)
Respiratory: Asthma, COPD, Emphysema

Blog: https://wearemore.life/blog
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wearemoreapp

Have an idea for improvement in the app? Let us know! Email us at support@wearemore.life

comments: Sketchy af. Tried to sign up normally... says you need to be at least 18... without any option to add age. Tried using a Google account to which you are told you need to allow it access to your google drive. Then you get a lovely little error message just when you think you're done. Yeah, because that's TOTALLY a normal thing that apps ask for access to. Cool concept, failed execution.

well I like the app but the user interface isn't very user friendly and the app keeps crashing on me for no apparent reason I'm using a Samsung Galaxy Note 8 I try to comment or post something but the entire app just stops usually before I can finish typing anything, I cannot identify any specific trigger for the crashes. app needs an update, it's been since November 2018 without 1

Would like to be able to reply to other messages on a post. Perhaps we should be able to follow people to receive notifications from them? Or just hve a notification bell im general, in case that person is...not doing so well, just to give advice and support. Also...perhaps insert some games? Nothing too big...card games and what not...some people feel as tho it is just either a little too depressing or a little too quiet within the app sometimes...

pro's and con's like most things.not much use to users outside the U.S but pretty good for American users.there are users on this app asking for money but then there are some genuine users who need and can give support.the app support is limited to be nice,a total joke to be honest.in my humble opinion i think this app is seriously flawed and the developers do not seem interested in fixing the problems.in general,id say the app is a great idea....but only if they make it work properly some day.
I am finding it very difficult to load, it takes a long time. I can't retrieve messages or see updates very well. It's running and loading frequently. Can this be fixed?

title: Circle Medical - See a Doctor Today
description:
Circle Medical is a primary care clinic with providers over video. Establish an ongoing relationship with a primary care provider for your general physical and mental health, preventive care, medications, referrals and treatment of chronic conditions — in addition to urgent issues that come up.

Currently available in 20 states (AZ, CA, CO, CT, DC, DE, IA, ID, IN, KY, MA, NC, ND, NH, NJ, NY, PA, TX, UT, WV) and accepting most insurance plans, there's no membership fee.

Circle Medical is a UCSF Health affiliate and operates two in-person clinics in San Francisco.

What you can do:
• Annual physicals/wellness exams
• Chronic disease management
• Sexual health consultations and screenings
• Sickness or injury visits
• Blood tests
• Prescriptions
• Referrals
• PrEP

Insurance we accept:
• Anthem Blue Cross
• Blue Cross Blue Shield
• UnitedHealthcare
• Blue Shield of California
• Aetna
• Cigna
• Health Net
• Humana
• Oscar

If you don't have insurance self-pay is $100 for a video visit.

Disclaimer: All medical services are provided by an independent physician group.
